Reviews.Title: “mmmmm.......”
Reviews.Author: matt_trav
Reviews.Content: the best location, but a bit overpriced for very basic rooms sharing bathroom, and i had the feeling our sheets were not clean, found a hair etc... with little more could be much better, hope they take note of that

Reviews.Title: “OK, for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kehveli
Reviews.Content: This is a cheapish pension in a very central location. It has no elevator so I wouldn't recommend it to handicapped or elderly persons. You might want to ask for a room facing the yard, since rooms with a view to the street can get noisy especially during weekends - at least in summertime the streets will be full of drunken youngsters. Service was nice and I really can't think of anything to complain. Just remember, it is a budget pension. Not a classy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place to sleep but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Vetiks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pension Dali for 3 nights durig our Spain trip. The good things about this place are: 1. Great location 2. Nice stuff 3. Low price The less nice points are: 1. The room and the bathroom were very small. 2. The room and the bath were not very spruce but generally clean. 3. The street is pretty noisy at night. We were Ok with it, but generally it is a disadvantage. 4. There are long and very steep stairs and no elevator. Take it into concideration when you are packing you luggage. Generally I can reccomend this hostel for young and singles who are not aware of luxury and comfortableness.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you are used to.”
Reviews.Author: Neil_and_Helen007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on a driving trip From Uk to South spain. Stayed one night to spend a Saturday in Barcelona & Leave Sunday morning. Only got about an hours sleep, noise was horrendous ! People in the hotel and outside it continued all night. Room was very basic but sort of clean. Do not stay here if you can afford and are used to better. But if on a shoe string and can sleep through an earthquake then i guess it may be o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great buy!”
Reviews.Author: nosheep
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews before selecting the Pension Dali for our two nights in Barcelona before departing on a trans-Atlantic cruise. Don't expect the Ritz. It's not fancy. It's an old, perhaps very old, building. There is no breakfast. Do expect a reasonably priced, clean and wonderfully located place to sleep. The check-in was flawless. The front desk was always staffed with someone who understood English. The room was clean. The bed comfortable. The bath servicable. There was a TV, but we don't watch on vacation. Our room was on the second floor over the side street and I was concerned about noise, but needn't have been. It was quiet after 10:00 p.m. The hotel is a block from a metro station (the only way to get around). Easy walking distance to the cathedral, shops, wonderful restaurants. It's less than 100 feet off the Rambla. If you're picky, pick something else, but if you want a well located place to lay your head, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky700
Reviews.Content: If you can afford more - Do not consider this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “ummmmmm......”
Reviews.Author: graveylordylasty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at pension dali for 2 nights as part of a hen weekend. Was certainly not expecting much from a 2* hostel but was still disappointed. Will admit that sheets and towels were clean and good location. Room was small and cramped, floor in bathroom had a hole in the bottom which filled with water and overflowed, hairs in bath and dirty sink. Could not see anything from window due to thick green meshing which made the room extremely dull. Friends had credit cards stolen from their room and we were informed from reception that the only other person with a key was the cleaner. Reception worn and tatty. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ABPat
Reviews.Content: Was really surprised when we were checking into this hotel as the price was reasonable considering you were 5 seconds from the Ramblars and we actually thought it was going to be horrible but alas, thankfully we were wrong. The hotel receptionist was an English bloke and very helpful. The room was a good size as there was 3 of us and very clean and tidy. The room had a fan in the ceiling to keep the room cool and the shower pressure in the bathroom was great. We thought it would be really noisy as you are so close to the main street but the only noise was from our neighbours knocking at the wrong door during the night. All in all great location and good hotel for what you pay for. We did 6 weeks of travelling and got much worse for alot more money. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No faults with the hotel and its location”
Reviews.Author: lucyeverett
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend had booked this hotel and i read the reviews on here and i thought, oh no!!! but when we got there it was in a really really good location, clean and just what i wanted out of a hotel room in the city centre! the thing i was most concerned about before going was the clenleness and i have to say that i could not fault it! i would definatly advise geting a room with its own bathroom!! i would definatly go again!!

Reviews.Title: “amazed at bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Rob2080
Reviews.Content: i stopped in pension dali on the 26th march 2007 for 3 nights, the reason for the visit was england v andorra football, and i also took the girlfriend, before we left we looked on this website and were both extremely worried about the hotel after reading some shockin reviews. Everybody is entitled to their opinion, of course, but for the price this hotel is the business. The location is absolutely fantastic and the staff were very helpful, the room was cleaned dailly, and we never felt let down by any aspect of the hotel. we booked early enough to get a fabulous room on the street with a balcony and a bathroom and it couldnt of been better for the price and location. i got woke up once by a bit of noise but that soon passed. barcelona is a fantastic city and is always buzzing, if i am to return i will definitely consider pension dali and my advise for you readers, is dont avoid after reading these bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was really helpful”
Reviews.Author: CrystalBall-7
Reviews.Content: I and my bf have just returned from a week in Barcelona. We decided to stay at Pension Dali, mostly because of the price and the location of course. We didn't expect much from the hotel and that's why we didn't get disappointed. We arrived 2 hours too early in hope to at least be able to leave the bags, but at our surprise we were given the key to the room immediately. The room was pretty nice and the beds were comfortable. Actually the most important to me was the cleanness and although the hotel needed a renovation the room itself was clean and the sheets as well as the towels smelled good. I haven't noticed any insects or anything disgusting, whatsoever, and that made me very happy! One thing worth mentioning was the staff that was really friendly and helpful. We had a few nice conversations with them, especially with an Argentininian guy. Anyways, I think I would recommend this hotel to ppl who are not very picky and travel to enjoy the environment and not the hotels. I think I could come back here...

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel does not deserve any bad reviews !!!”
Reviews.Author: CEVH
Reviews.Content: Do not listen to any of the bad reviews of Pension Dali on this site. It certainly does not deserve them. It has great character, and an excellent location. The staff are both friendy and helpful. Looking at previous reviews, vistiors who want 5 star luxury should do their homework before booking. They should not be stupid enough to expect it from a Hotel with a 2 star rating. Enough said! We had room 316 on the top floor overlooking the street. There was slight noise, but that's what you expect from a City Hotel. It soon died down after midnight anyway. There was also a small lift to get you there as well which was most welcome after spending all day taking in the sights of Barcelona. The room complete with en-suite bathroom was clean and secure, with both locks and bolts. We also had Maid service every day with clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: r0b26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutly fine. Its an average hotel, if you go here expecting the Ritz then you will be very disapointed, but go there being realistic and you will have a great time. the rooms are a decant size, the staff were very friendly and the location couldnt of been better. Yes at night time its a little noisy, but when you look at the location its not that surprising. When i was there i spent little time in the room as i was to busy seeing the sights and sounds of Barcelona, and as somewhere to spend the night, get washed and changed, this hotel is excellant and very reasonabley priced. I would ceetainly stay here again without question!

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: screename
Reviews.Content: unless you are on a very tight budget and cannot bear to be more than 50 metres away from the ramblas then give this hole a miss. the place does not feel safe or clean. one night i saw some guy off the street who had some how got the money togrther booking a room for the night, this did not make us feel very safe at all. hotels that allow tramps and people who sleep rough on the streets to book in, are in my book to be avoided at all costs. look a little bit further away from the ramblas and pay the same money for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and different”
Reviews.Author: sdwyer
Reviews.Content: myself & my wife stayed here in nov. & we had a ball. The boys in reception were great very helpful & great fun. The room was very basic but it didn't cost alot so thats ok, it had a tv, its own bathroom & was cleaned everyday. The lift to say the least was rare, it rattled it banged & it shook but it worked & we found it an experience. We would stay there again, if you want cheep & basic this is the place, if you want to treat yourself splash out on an hotel. Aidan & Susan Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but did the job nicely”
Reviews.Author: bpbbabe99
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here at the start of August. Our room was extremely basic and small, our bathroom was outide of the room but luckily we were the only people using that particular toilet. The man on reception was very nice and friendly and made us feel welcome. We only paid £17 a night so it was well worth it, and being right in the heart of everything, a basic room is what i'd expect and it did the job! We booked online thtough [---] and had no problems with it. I'd definitely stay there again with it being such a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place, avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: JourneyKat
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay here for three nights, but only stayed one. My husband and I have stayed in some pretty utilitarian places over the years, but this was by far the worst. We have never cancelled a reservation after seeing the condition of the accommodations, so this was a first for us. I guess our first clue should have come when we had a really hard time making a reservation. The reason it was so difficult, is because the e-mail address on the pension's site was no longer operational. I finally had to call, and then the front desk person provided me with a functional e-mail address. It would not have taken much effort to update the web site. Last time I checked, the incorrect address is still listed on the site. The room only had one electrical outlet, and this was in the bathroom. Forget plugging in a computer, or any other device for that matter. In addition, we were told that internet service was available in the lobby but, when we got there, we were told that they "used to have it" but it's been broken for a while and needs to be fixed. If we hadn't brought ear plugs, we wouldn't have gotten any sleep. The noise from outside was constant until about 4 or 5:00am. The location is appealing, but there are lots of hotels and pensions near la Rambla, so the Pension Dali is not unique in this regard, and its location alone would be no reason to book here. Also, there's really nothing about Dali that is reflected in the pension, except a picture of him that hangs over the front desk. Some of the front desk people acted like we were a bother, for example, the one that was sleeping on the couch when we went downstairs. While the room smelled strongly of bleach, there was mold growing on the toilet tank and between the shower tiles. There was also a pile of dirt under the radiator, which suggested that the room hadn't been thoroughly cleaned in quite some time. The tub was so small, we kept feeling like we were going to slip and fall if we moved. The price for a double room with private bathroom was 59 Euros per night, which is approximately $74.00. The room we got was worth maybe (MAYBE!) 30 Euros per night ($38).
